title: Tartu railway station
text:
Tartu railway station () is the main railway station in <a href="Tartu">Tartu</a>, <a href="Estonia">Estonia</a>. 
Tartu railway station is situated west of the centre Tartu. It was established in 1876 when <a href="Tapa%2C%20Estonia">Tapa</a>–Tartu route was built. The station building was opened in 1877.
Passenger trains are operated by <a href="Elron%20%28rail%20transit%29">Elron</a> and most services are towards <a href="Tallinn">Tallinn</a>. There are also services to <a href="Valga%2C%20Estonia">Valga</a> and to <a href="J%C3%B5geva">Jõgeva</a>, <a href="Orava%2C%20Estonia">Orava</a>, <a href="Koidula%2C%20V%C3%B5ru%20County">Koidula</a> and <a href="Piusa">Piusa</a>.
There are two platforms with the length of 260m and 330m.
